column4: what do you all recommend as the partition setup for a gaming computer? my HDD will be 500Gb, I was thinking of having enough of it partitioned for windows to store my games. But I also want to be able to access them from Ubuntu. Would I be able to play a windows game from my windows partition from wine? I'm just worried because I know it's fine to read from a windows partition using linux, but I heard it could be harmful to write to it, s
you can even write to ntfs, its just not suggested

ok, but does wine handle it differently? I won't be manually writing to it, but wine might, so because it is made to run windows programs those programs would write to the disk in a windows friendly way... right?  or is it a potential problem?
OR, is there a way that I could have a sort of "neutral" partition that is safe for both OS's to read and write to?
sadly windows cant read any other filesystem besides ntfs/fat
ok what about this then, I make 3 partitions, linux, windows, and a third NTFS partition just for games.
i cant say it will never brake, but alot days ago i used wine to run win games on win partition, and i didnot brake anything
and that was like few years ago
if anything windows wanted to checkdisc, didnot brake the filesystem in any case
if it does "break" would that just mess up the partition it's on, or all partitions?
i would think that nowdays with ntfs3g driver on linux, it will not brake
but it wouldnot be safe for production enviroinment, but for home use why not
in the old days the writing to ntfs was dangerous, thou it did work even then
ok, but just to to clarify, what do we mean by "break"? if it just messes up the partition it's on then I wouldn't worry too much. But if it breaks my HDD, I'd rather not risk it lol.
basicaly if i would be you i would go with two partisions win/linux rather then 3
the thing is some games want to write to c:\ aswell not only d:\games
so i m not sure will you benefit from 3 parts
